product_name: e.l.f. CosmeticsHoly Hydration! Makeup Melting Cleansing Balm
summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeVeganWatch your makeup melt away with e.l.f. SKIN's Holy Hydration! Makeup Melting Cleansing Balm! It's solid balm form melts into a luxurious oil and turns into a nourishing milk texture that rinses off clean.
details: DetailsBenefitsSolid cleansing balm melts into a luxurious oil texture that melts away makeupEasily removes makeup without stripping the skinLeaves skin feeling silky smooth, plumped, & hydratedGreat for: dry, oil & combination skin100% vegan & cruelty-free, e.l.f. is Leaping Bunny Certifiede.l.f. is proud to partner with Fair Trade USA and manufacture products in Fair Trade Certified facilities; look for the Fair Trade Certified seal on your e.l.f. productFormulated WithoutSulfatesPhthalatesParabensNonylphenol ethoxylatesTriclosanTriclocarbanHydroquinoneItem 2576049How To UseStep 1: Scoop out a dime-sized amount of makeup melting balm with the included spatula and massage onto dry skin.Step 2: Moisten fingertips and continue to massage into the skin using circular motions. For makeup removal, apply all over carefully ensuring eyes are closed and watch your makeup melt away!Step 3: Rinse with water or remove with a warm damp cleansing cloth.Pro Tip: To double cleanse for that extra-clean feeling, follow with your favorite e.l.f. cleanser, like Holy Hydration! Daily Cleanser.Step 4: Use the Keep Your Balance Toner to remove any remaining impurities.Step 5: Keep your skin hydrated and moisturized using the Holy Hydration! Face Cream.Step 6: Hydrate under eyes with the Holy Hydration! Eye Cream.IngredientsCetyl Ethylhexanoate, Triethylhexanoin, PEG-20 Glyceryl Triisostearate, Hydrogenated Polydecene, Synthetic Wax, PEG-10 Isostearate, Palmitoyl Tripeptide-1, Palmitoyl Tetrapeptide-7, Ceramide NP, Ceramide AP, Ceramide EOP, Hydrolyzed Sodium Hyaluronate, Phytosphingosine, Glycerin, Butylene Glycol, Water (Aqua), Polysorbate 20, Carbomer, Xanthan Gum, Cholesterol, Sodium Lauroyl Lactylate, Phenoxyethanol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Caprylyl Glycol, Geraniol, Linalool, Fragrance (Parfum).Ingredients may change or vary from time to time. Please refer to the packaging of the product you receive for the list of ingredients in your particular product.
how_to_use: Step 1: Scoop out a dime-sized amount of makeup melting balm with the included spatula and massage onto dry skin.Step 2: Moisten fingertips and continue to massage into the skin using circular motions. For makeup removal, apply all over carefully ensuring eyes are closed and watch your makeup melt away!Step 3: Rinse with water or remove with a warm damp cleansing cloth.Pro Tip: To double cleanse for that extra-clean feeling, follow with your favorite e.l.f. cleanser, like Holy Hydration! Daily Cleanser.Step 4: Use the Keep Your Balance Toner to remove any remaining impurities.Step 5: Keep your skin hydrated and moisturized using the Holy Hydration! Face Cream.Step 6: Hydrate under eyes with the Holy Hydration! Eye Cream.

reviews.headline: Melts away the day
reviews.comments: Honestly there's nothing to say other than, just buy it!

reviews.headline: Love it!
reviews.comments: This works so well! It removes all my makeup effortlessly, and leaves my skin feeling soft and clean. I love how gentle it isâ€”definitely a must-have in my routine!

reviews.headline: This Balm is the Bonmb
reviews.comments: This is my first makeup remover step (including Eyes) in my 2 step cleanse. The product is effective in removing all makeup and rinses off with water. I like to follow with a second skin cleanser.

reviews.headline: Love how this removes mascara
reviews.comments: I really like this product, it feels good, a little goes a long way and it actually removes mascara.   Some mascaras can be hard to remove and this product does it well.  Would definitely recommend (and have to friends) and would repurchase.

reviews.headline: Great makeup removing balm
reviews.comments: This affordable makeup removing balm from Elf works great, is easy on my dry and sensitive skin, and even removes eye makeup. I have repurchased this at least three times. You do need to use a cloth to help get the eye make up off but it definitely works better than most every other remover I've tried.

reviews.headline: it's okay
reviews.comments: I gave it a three star because it's just not gentle around the eye area. and that's a big issue for me

reviews.headline: This is my go to makeup remover.
reviews.comments: I love everything about it! Easy to use, removes my makeup and gentle on my 62 year old skin.

reviews.headline: Former Farmacy Green Clean Loyalist Double Cleanser
reviews.comments: I use makeup balms as the first step of my double cleanse. Until a recent formula change, I had used Farmacy Green Clean for 5+ years. I have tried Belif and Clinique's cleansing balms as potential replacements and now elf. elf gets the make up off just as well as the others. I do think it has a bit of an oilier consistency and a stronger fragrance, but for a fraction of the price of the others it isn't a deal breaker for me. Not as good as the original Farmacy Green Clean, but since tjat is no longer an option, I'll repurchase this one.

reviews.headline: Clogged Pores, Left Bumps
reviews.comments:
I really wanted to like this. It removed the makeup well but for some reason it must've clogged my pores because it left bumps on my eyelids. :( 
They went away when I stopped using the product thank goodness.

reviews.headline: Would be great minus the fragrance
reviews.comments: I picked this up hearing about the great reviews and also pure curiosity with the hopes of finding a new makeup remover/cleanser. Good news: it works really well. The formula is nice. With the help of a reusable makeup cloth, even waterproof mascara and eyeliner came right off. Until the irritation happened. I used it for four days, broke out, and have red, irritated skin. If you have sensitive skin, don't use this product as the ingredient used for the fragranced part of it may damage your skin. Should elf remake this product with no scents, I'd be all for it.

reviews.headline: The best ever try
reviews.comments: Omg I never leave reviews on stuff but this stuff is amazing and it blows my mind how well it works to cleanse my face without water! I will buy it again put this time the big sized.

reviews.headline: BUY THIS NOW
reviews.comments: So basically, I decided to wear a new mascara and when it was time to take it off, it was not budging. Micellar water didn't work. Not even castor oil. I tried multiple different makeup removers and this is the ONLY thing that worked and it took 5 seconds, not even. My eyes were so sore and red from rubbing and trying so many other removers but this did the job so easily. ELF YOU SAVED MY LIFEðŸ˜©ðŸ˜©

reviews.headline: Good
reviews.comments: The best of best i have useðŸ™‚

reviews.headline: best first step for a double cleanse
reviews.comments: I love this!! it's the first cleansing balm I've ever used and I don't see the need to try others. my skin feels so soft after using it. the only downside is that it doesn't easily melt off my mascara (not waterproof), but I don't really mind because my cleanser gets everything it missed washed off

reviews.headline: MUST BUY!!!!
reviews.comments:
this melts your makeup off so easy without being too harsh.
love it and will rather use this than makeup wipes.

reviews.headline: Works, but not the best
reviews.comments: I will say it does remove all of my eye makeup,  but there is a lot of massaging involved. I remove it in the shower and use a pad to wipe clean. I found that it really makes my eyes dry afterwards, which I've not experienced before. It's a good price point, but I probably won't purchase again.

reviews.headline: Obsessed
reviews.comments: This is my very first cleansing balm and I love it! I have sensitive dry skin so wiping my skin with cotton pads or makeup remover wipes causes irritation and flaking for me. If you're in the same boat as I was and looking for an alternative, I highly recommend this! My makeup melts away so effortlessly and I even use it as part of a double cleanse some nights when I'm not wearing makeup. There is a slight fragrance that personally doesn't bother me, but if you're sensitive to smells keep that in mind. As a newbie to the skincare world I love Elf's products because they're so easy to use and great quality for the price!

reviews.headline: Best Cleansing Balm in the game
reviews.comments: I have sensitive/acne prone combo skin so it is hard finding products that work for me. This has ingredients to gently remove makeup and to fight against acne without causing a breakout. I will continue to buy this and recommend to try for everyone!

reviews.headline: Yes!
reviews.comments: I love how this melts away my makeup.

reviews.headline: Remover
reviews.comments: Great comparable to clinique.

media.headline: e.l.f does it again
media.caption: Product Review/e.l.f. Holy Hydration Makeup Melting Balm

media.headline: DO NOT USE IF YOU HAVE ECZEMA
Really refreshing and melts away that you had on.
media.caption: Amazing.

media.headline: A little bit goes a long way
media.caption: Elf Holy Hydration! Cleansing Balm

faceoff_positive.comments: I LOVE this cleansing balm. Cleansing balms are usually my favorite way to remove makeup. In the past, I've used a few others including Farmacy's Green Clean but I haven't found one gentle enough to remove my heavy makeup around my eyes without irritating my eyes at the same time. While I always double cleanse after using a cleansing balm anyway, which would breakdown any leftover oil, I like that this balm doesn't leave an uncomfortable film of oil on the skin. I would highly recommend this balm to anyone with sensitive skin or anyone that wears a full face of makeup regularly. It's extremely gentle yet incredibly effective, especially for the price.
faceoff_positive.headline: Super gentle cleansing balm!

faceoff_negative.comments: I REALLY wanted to buy this cleansing balm. The e.l.f. Holy Hydration moisturizer is amazing and I fell in love with it, looking forward to trying their Cannabis moisturizer next! However, one of the ingredients that is higher up on the list (which means there's a higher concentration of it in there for those who didn't know) is polyethylene, which is essentially plastic. Someone else left a review on it saying the same thing, and elf responded saying WHAT the polyethylene was in the product for; what elf didn't say is how polyethylene pollutes our water and damages marine wildlife. While I understand why a big company like elf would use and ingredient such as this for mass production purposes, I would prefer to not spend my money on a product with a known pollutant in it. If elf reformulated without the polyethylene, *chef's kiss* take my money
faceoff_negative.headline: Polyethylene=Pollutant

rollup.name: Holy Hydration! Makeup Melting Cleansing Balm
